sec.p: This study employed a sample of 236 Kaohsiung residents and used questionnaires and face-to-face interviews to collect information. Among the 235 valid responses in this study, females (55.3%) outnumbered males (44.7%). Respondents aged 20–29 years (25.1%), followed by those aged 30–39 years (18.7%). The majority of respondents had completed a college education (36.6%). Of the respondents, 54.9% were not married. The largest group of respondents reported TWD$5,000 (US$175) in personal monthly disposable income. Finally, with respect to religion, the largest category was respondents with “no religious beliefs” (38%), followed by Buddhists (20%) and Taoists (12.6%).
